intro: Carpesium szechuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan thistle, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a dense, spherical inflorescence. It is often found in mountainous regions and has adaptations that allow it to thrive in cooler, temperate climates. Its foliage is generally hairy and aromatic, contributing to its ecological and horticultural significance.
